availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Webster County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Priscilla B. Talbot Sammons. Father of William G. Sammons, Jane Sammons, James Sammons, Julia Sammons, Malvenia Sammons, Emma Sammons, and Samuel M. Sammons. Farmer in Henderson County in 1850. Farmer in Webster County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Webster County, p. 61. Cynthia E. Snider, Bateman, Grayson, Boyett, Carter, and Cole Families and their Kin as they Marked the Way (Ann Arbor, Michigan: Malloy Lithographing, Inc., 1995), 84. Find A Grave, "William Sammons (1806-1897)," Memorial #141850962, https://findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=141850962 (accessed August,
23, 2017).
